body_html:
@VigneshSrinivasan10 in this case I think its best to put all patches belonging to the same image in one batch reshaping it to a 2d-tensor and then using tf.nn.conv2d to handle the overlap.

As this is not trivial to implement and something which I think occurs quite often it would really be great to have this supported by tensorflow.
body_text:
@VigneshSrinivasan10 in this case I think its best to put all patches belonging to the same image in one batch reshaping it to a 2d-tensor and then using tf.nn.conv2d to handle the overlap.
As this is not trivial to implement and something which I think occurs quite often it would really be great to have this supported by tensorflow.
body:
@VigneshSrinivasan10 in this case I think its best to put all `patches` belonging to the same `image` in one `batch` reshaping it to a 2d-tensor and then using `tf.nn.conv2d` to handle the overlap.

As this is not trivial to implement and something which I think occurs quite often it would really be great to have this supported by tensorflow.
